title: Rudolph Bochco, 77, Violinist; Appeared With Top Artists
title_page: Rudolph Bochco, 77, Violinist; Appeared With Top Artists - The New York Times
maintext:
â€˜ Rudolph Bochco, a violinist, died of cancer Thursday at his home in Los Angeles. He was /7 years old. Of Russian extraction, he was born in Poland and was brought to the United States when he was 3 years old. He studied with the famous teacher Leopold Auer and toured extensively in the 1920's and 1930's, frequently appearing with such artists as Titta Ruffo, baritone; Arthur Rubinstein, pianist, and John McCormack, tenor.
He gave his first New York recital in 1920 at Carnegie Hall and played here often until 1962. He was a pioneer in the performance of early music, and in the 1930's, with the pianist. Jacques Malkin. founded the Renaissance Quintet. In 1946 he introduced three Paganini sonatas for violin and guitar in a Town Hall program.
He is survived by his wife Mimi; a son, Steven; a daughter, Joanna, and two grandchildren.
